subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Orthodox, Conservative, Reform: Modern Judaism
description: A 60-second lesson on Orthodox, Conservative, Reform: Modern Judaism.

hook.text: Some Jews keep every ancient law strictly. Others reinterpret them freely. Both call themselves Jewish. Who's right?

buildup.text: Orthodox Jews follow traditional law closely: kosher food, Sabbath rest, gender-separated worship.

discovery.text: Reform Judaism, born in 19th-century Germany, adapted law to modern life. Women rabbis, LGBTQ+ inclusion followed.

twist.text: Conservative Judaism sits between them ‚Äî respecting tradition while allowing careful change. A middle path.

climax.text: These branches argue fiercely. But all share Torah, community, and memory. Judaism thrives on internal diversity.

punchline.text: Three branches, one Torah. Judaism's diversity is its survival strategy.

quiz.question: What distinguishes Reform Judaism from Orthodox Judaism?
options: Reform adapts traditional law to modern life
